function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Difficulty in establishing a simple relationship between air change rate increases and the width of opening of a single window.","Impact":"Inability to accurately predict the impact of window opening on air change rate and ventilation.","Mitigation":"Conducting more comprehensive and controlled experiments to account for all variables and conditions.","Technologies":"Air quality sensors, computational fluid dynamics (CFD) simulations.","People":"Research scientists, environmental engineers, architects, building designers.","Owner":"Research institutions, environmental engineering firms, building design firms."},{"Description":"Rapid tracer decay or 'whoosh' observed after opening a window, leading to a short-lived, significant dilution of existing tracer gas in the immediate air volume.","Impact":"Temporary decrease in air quality and potential exposure to outdoor contaminants during the 'whoosh' period.","Mitigation":"Implementing controlled ventilation strategies to minimize the impact of rapid tracer decay, such as adjusting window opening size and duration.","Technologies":"Air quality sensors, ventilation control systems, indoor air quality monitors.","People":"Building occupants, environmental health and safety managers, facility managers.","Owner":"Building owners, property management firms, facility management teams."}]}
